task.title: Gross up Earnings and Taxes for Net Pay Amounts
task.shortdesc: Grossing Up is a method used to determine gross wages when the employer needs to pay an employee a specified net pay amount. You can also add or remove withholding amounts and additional percentages for payroll taxes, including federal, state, and local taxes.

step.cmd: From either the View/Change Employee Pay Check or the Instant Check Details page, check the Gross Up box on an additional pay or an instant check for an employee.
From the Gross Up page, enter the desired net amount of the pay.
Select the earnings code for the gross up calculation.

note.p: There must be at least one earnings record with a flat amount calculation on a non-regular check to compute a net amount based on the gross up calculation. If none exists, add a flat earnings record to the employee before beginning the gross up calculation.

step.cmd: Check the Federal, State, or Local Tax boxes for the appropriate taxes to be included in the gross up calculation.

note.p: Social Security (USSOC) and Medicare (USMED) taxes are included in the gross up calculation.

step.cmd: Check the Include Additional % box for the applicable tax if an additional amount of federal, state, or local tax will be included as part of the gross up calculation.

note.p: Additional tax amounts withheld are on the Income Tax page for the employee.

step.cmd: Click OK to return to the View/Change Employee Pay Check page.
Click Save to process the gross up calculation and view the resulting gross up calculation and net pay amount.

note.p: If a deduction is present before the Gross Up box is checked, the deduction amount will be included in the resulting gross up calculation.

The calculation process for gross-to-net amounts for pre-check results may be completed for regular pays at the time you add an additional pay for a gross up earnings. You must calculate the additional pay separately or rerun the calculation process for all pays.
